result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan L Delaney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with all standard release conditions

miscConds.notes:
Payment of restitution when set

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

no contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Restitution to be determined at a later date

2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan L Delaney in court.  Attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf Esq in court for Ryan L Delaney. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
State moves to amend.  
State files amended information. 
Defense accepts receipt of the amended information and waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Court will adjourn the sentencing until a further date in this matter to see if parties can resolve restitution amounts in this matter.
